snippet: The company said that would stop using brominated vegetable oil, which contains bromine, an element found in flame retardants, in Fresca and some varieties of Fanta and fountain drinks.
abstract: Coca-Cola, responding to consumer concerns, says that it will stop using brominated vegetable oil, which contains bromine, element found in flame retardants, in Fresca and some varieties of Fanta and fountain drinks.
lead_paragraph: The company said that would stop using brominated vegetable oil, which contains bromine, an element found in flame retardants, in Fresca and some varieties of Fanta and fountain drinks.

headline.main: Coca-Cola to Remove an Ingredient Questioned by Consumers
headline.print_headline: Coca-Cola to Remove an Ingredient Questioned by Consumers
